alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Pointe Coupee; West Feliciana (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 18 at 7:39PM CDT until March 31 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Mississippi River At Baton Rouge affecting West Baton Rouge and East Baton Rouge Parishes. Mississippi River At Red River Landing affecting West Feliciana, East Baton Rouge and Pointe Coupee Parishes. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY, MARCH 31... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Red River Landing. * WHEN...Until Thursday, March 31. * IMPACTS...At 51.0 feet, All river islands along the reach from Red River Landing to Baton Rouge will be inundated. Recreational camps and river bottom farm land will be under water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CDT Friday the stage was 52.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Thursday, March 31 and continue falling to 42.4 feet Friday, April 15. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 53.1 feet on 05/25/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Pointe Coupee; West Feliciana
